title: How to Make Baked Cinnamon Apple Snacks

steps.headline: Slice washed apples.
steps.description: A mandolin is the best way to get uniform, thin slices, however if you don't own one, carefully slice apples (1/2” at the thickest) using a sharp knife and cutting board.

steps.headline: Pour cinnamon into a bowl.
steps.description: No specific measurements here---you will need to pour enough cinnamon to coat your batch of apples.

steps.headline: Toss sliced apples in cinnamon.
steps.description: The apple slices don't have to be completely caked with cinnamon, but a light sprinkling will do the trick.

steps.headline: Lay apples on pre-sprayed baking sheet.
steps.description: Don't pile apples on each other, but rather lay them out like they are cookies, providing a little space between each slice.

steps.headline: Bake at 200F for 1 ½ hours.
steps.description: Your house will smell amazing as the apples slowly cook. Flip apples over with a spatula at the 1 ½ hour mark and then bake another 1 ½ hours until crisp.

steps.headline: Turn oven off at the second 1 ½ hour mark and allow them to cool in the oven (this helps them become more crispy).
Store in an air-tight container in a cool, dry area of the kitchen.

text: Slice washed apples. A mandolin is the best way to get uniform, thin slices, however if you don't own one, carefully slice apples (1/2” at the thickest) using a sharp knife and cutting board. Pour cinnamon into a bowl. No specific measurements here---you will need to pour enough cinnamon to coat your batch of apples. Toss sliced apples in cinnamon. The apple slices don't have to be completely caked with cinnamon, but a light sprinkling will do the trick. Lay apples on pre-sprayed baking sheet. Don't pile apples on each other, but rather lay them out like they are cookies, providing a little space between each slice. Bake at 200F for 1 ½ hours. Your house will smell amazing as the apples slowly cook. Flip apples over with a spatula at the 1 ½ hour mark and then bake another 1 ½ hours until crisp. Turn oven off at the second 1 ½ hour mark and allow them to cool in the oven (this helps them become more crispy).  Store in an air-tight container in a cool, dry area of the kitchen.
